data.title: Wall Street lower as Meta, Microsoft earnings dampen mood; Apple, Amazon results in focus
data.description:
The stock market opened lower on Thursday, as investors were left unimpressed by Meta (META) and Microsoft (MSFT) results. Traders were now geared up for Apple (AAPL) and Amazon (AMZN) earnings and assessed the latest updates of the U.S.-China trade talks.

S&P 500 (SP500) -0.5%, the Dow (DJI) -0.5%, and the Nasdaq Composite (COMP:IND) -0.7%.

The 10-year Treasury yield (US10Y) rose 3 basis points to 3.64%. The 2-year yield (US2Y) rose 3 basis points to 4.11%.

U.S. President Donald Trump announced a one-year agreement with China covering rare earths and critical minerals, while also halving fentanyl-related tariffs on Beijing (from 20% to 10%), effective immediately, following his meeting with Chinese President Xi Jinping in South Korea on Thursday.

"Despite its brevity, it appears that there was some progress in U.S.-China trade negotiations. But perhaps not quite as much as President Trump had signaled earlier this week...There was no word on either the future of Taiwan or TikTok. So, summing up the conclusion to this historic meeting: underwhelming," David Morrison, senior market analyst at Trade Nation, said.

"The U.S. (though not yet China) announced a year-long Sino-U.S. trade agreement. The details have to be worked out. Markets are likely to be cheered, but not wildly enthusiastic," UBS' Paul Donovan said. 

Traders and investors watched markets end the day mixed on Wednesday after the FOMC announced a 25-basis-point rate cut.

The Fed reduced its benchmark interest rate by 25 basis points to 3.75%-4.00%, its second straight cut, as it seeks to ease off the brakes in an effort to protect the labor market.

"On rates policy, our economists maintain a baseline of a 25 bps rate cut in December but see the hawkish-leaning signal as consistent with their view of fundamentals pointing to fewer rate cuts than priced by markets," Deutsche Bank's Jim Reid said. 

"The Fed spoke with an almost British accent yesterday, cutting rates a quarter point with a Bank of England-like three-way vote split. Fed Chair Jerome Powell signaled that a December cut was not inevitable," Donovan said.

Wednesday also saw a slew of tech companies report their earnings, namely Microsoft (MSFT), Alphabet (GOOG)(GOOGL) and Meta (META). 

Meta Platforms (META) was down 12.5% in early trade as it recorded a one-time income tax charge of nearly $16B and also raised its full-year guidance for total expenses.

Class A shares (GOOGL) of Alphabet rose 4.2%, while class C shares (GOOG) also added 4.3% as the firm delivered its first-ever quarter with $100B in revenue, while its AI assistant Gemini app hit over 650M monthly active users.

Microsoft (MSFT) was down 1.9% even after it topped quarterly expectations, though its investments in ChatGPT developer OpenAI hit its profit.

"Then after the market close, we saw results from Microsoft, Meta, and Alphabet send contrasting signals on the payoffs from the AI investment boom. The three tech giants saw their joint capex bill rise 89% Y/Y to $78B in the latest quarter," Reid said.

In the day ahead, traders will get more tech earnings, with Apple (AAPL) and Amazon (AMZN) set to report after the closing bell.

data.title: Canaan wins 4.5 MW mining server contract
data.description:
• Canaan (CAN) announced on Thursday a 4.5-megawatt sales contract with an electrical engineering solutions provider to deploy Avalon A1566HA-488T hydro-cooled mining servers for real-time grid balancing and energy-efficiency optimization in Japan. The facility is led by a major regional utility.
  • The Avalon servers will operate continuously to help stabilize regional power-grid load through controlled overclocking and underclocking, beginning by the end of 2025, said the company. 
  • CAN -7.29% premarket to $1.27.
  • Source: Press Release

data.title: Webull expands crypto futures offering
data.description:
Webull (BULL) announced on Thursday the expansion of its crypto futures offering through an ongoing partnership with Coinbase's (COIN) futures exchange, Coinbase Derivatives.

The online investment platform said its users now will be able to trade futures contracts for Dogecoin (DOGE-USD), Nano XRP, Nano Solana, Litecoin (LTC-USD), XRP (XRP-USD), and Solana (SOL-USD).

Webull had launched futures and commodities trading in March 2024.

BULL shares were -1.28% pre-market to $10.82.

data.title: U.S. Antimony surges after Stibnite mining restart, 2026 revenue forecast hike
data.description:
United States Antimony (UAMY) +10.4% pre-market Thursday after raising its FY 2026 revenue guidance by $25 million-$125 million, more than double the company's 2025 revenue outlook of $40 million-$50 million.

The increase in projected revenue follows the company's announcement that it will resume extraction activities at the Stibnite Hill site in Montana.

The company said preliminary test work by its metallurgical team indicates the antimony ore at Stibnite Hill can be upgraded to meet the military specifications for material to be used for primers for munitions.

"This announcement today is a game changer for all USAC shareholders. When we began operations on Stibnite Hill earlier this year, we anticipated finding antimony deposits, but nothing like we are currently experiencing. We currently anticipate that profit margins mining our own antimony material will be approximately three times greater than buying from third parties," U.S. Antimony (UAMY) Chairman and CEO Gary Evans said.

Also providing a boost to the stock was the agreement between the U.S. and China to implement an annual deal governing rare earth exports, to be renegotiated each year, easing some concerns over access to critical minerals.

data.title: Safe and Green Development announces satisfaction of outstanding convertible debt
data.description:
• Safe and Green Development (SGD) said on Thursday that it has satisfied in full and retired all of its outstanding convertible debt obligations.
  • This milestone marks a significant achievement in strengthening the company's balance sheet. 
  • Safe and Green Development (SGD) shares were up more than 12% in premarket trading.

data.title: Red River Bancshares GAAP EPS of $1.63 beats by $0.10, revenue of $31.91M beats by $0.63M
data.description:
• Red River Bancshares press release (RRBI): Q3 GAAP EPS of $1.63 beats by $0.10.
  • Revenue of $31.91M (+14.9% Y/Y) beats by $0.63M.

data.title: Tetra Tech awarded £17 million water engineering design contract
data.description:
• Tetra Tech (TTEK) said on Thursday that it has been selected by Portsmouth Water for a £17 million water engineering design contract.
  • The company will provide engineering design and technical support to deliver resilient water service to its customers in Southern England and advance their programs to meet new regulatory targets.
  • Tetra Tech’s water engineers will design high-end solutions to improve critical infrastructure including reservoirs, pipes, and treatment plants that serve more than 700,000 people.
  • TTEK -0.47% premarket to $31.7.
  • Source: Press Release

data.title: Citizens Financial Services GAAP EPS of $2.09 beats by $0.33, revenue of $28.99M
data.description:
• Citizens Financial Services press release (CZFS): Q3 GAAP EPS of $2.09 beats by $0.33.
  • Revenue of $28.99M.

data.title: ECB holds interest rate steady at 2%
data.description:
The European Central Bank kept its interest rates unchanged on Thursday for a third meeting in a row amid low inflation and steady growth.

The eurozone economy grew a better-than-expected 0.2% in the third quarter, flash data showed Thursday.

The ECB cut rates by a combined two percentage points in the year to June but has been on the sidelines since. The trim came as the eurozone's annual inflation rate hit 2%, the ECB’s target, though the rate of price rises has risen since, to 2.2% in September.

data.title: Climb Global Solutions declares $0.17 dividend
data.description:
• Climb Global Solutions (CLMB) declares $0.17/share quarterly dividend, in line with previous.
  • Forward yield 0.51%
  • Payable Nov. 17; for shareholders of record Nov. 10; ex-div Nov. 10.
  • See CLMB Dividend Scorecard, Yield Chart, & Dividend Growth.
